intro: Celmisia saxifraga, commonly known as the rock celery, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its hairy, erect stems and clusters of small, yellowish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a distinctive waxy coating. Celmisia saxifraga is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens with suitable conditions.
